claim: The average attribute value of neutral superheroes has increased steadily every year since 2000.
extra_info: average = AVG(attribute_value); neutral superheroes refers to alignment_id = 3;
reasoning: The claim references yearly trends ('increased steadily every year since 2000'), but the database contains no year, date, or temporal column in any table. There is no way to track changes over time or group attribute values by year. This is an out-of-schema concept that cannot be verified.

content.text: I'll start by exploring the database schema to understand what tables and columns are available.

input.description: List all tables in the superhero database

content.content:
alignment       colour          hero_attribute  publisher       superhero     
attribute       gender          hero_power      race            superpower

tool_use_result.stdout:
alignment       colour          hero_attribute  publisher       superhero     
attribute       gender          hero_power      race            superpower

content.content:
CREATE TABLE alignment
(
    id        INTEGER not null
            primary key,
    alignment TEXT default NULL
);
CREATE TABLE attribute
(
    id             INTEGER not null
            primary key,
    attribute_name TEXT default NULL
);
CREATE TABLE colour
(
    id     INTEGER not null
            primary key,
    colour TEXT default NULL
);
CREATE TABLE gender
(
    id     INTEGER not null
            primary key,
    gender TEXT default NULL
);
CREATE TABLE publisher
(
    id             INTEGER not null
            primary key,
    publisher_name TEXT default NULL
);
CREATE TABLE race
(
    id   INTEGER not null
            primary key,
    race TEXT default NULL
);
CREATE TABLE superhero
(
    id             INTEGER not null
            primary key,
    superhero_name TEXT default NULL,
    full_name      TEXT default NULL,
    gender_id      INTEGER          default NULL,
    eye_colour_id  INTEGER          default NULL,
    hair_colour_id INTEGER          default NULL,
    skin_colour_id INTEGER          default NULL,
    race_id        INTEGER          default NULL,
    publisher_id   INTEGER          default NULL,
    alignment_id   INTEGER          default NULL,
    height_cm      INTEGER          default NULL,
    weight_kg      INTEGER          default NULL,
    foreign key (alignment_id) references alignment(id),
    foreign key (eye_colour_id) references colour(id),
    foreign key (gender_id) references gender(id),
    foreign key (hair_colour_id) references colour(id),
    foreign key (publisher_id) references publisher(id),
    foreign key (race_id) references race(id),
    foreign key (skin_colour_id) references colour(id)
);
CREATE TABLE hero_attribute
(
    hero_id         INTEGER default NULL,
    attribute_id    INTEGER default NULL,
    attribute_value INTEGER default NULL,
    foreign key (attribute_id) references attribute(id),
    foreign key (hero_id) references superhero(id)
);
CREATE TABLE superpower
(
    id         INTEGER not null
            primary key,
    power_name TEXT default NULL
);
CREATE TABLE hero_power
(
    hero_id  INTEGER default NULL,
    power_id INTEGER default NULL,
    foreign key (hero_id) references superhero(id),
    foreign key (power_id) references superpower(id)
);

content.text:
The claim mentions "every year since 2000," implying a time/year dimension. Let me check if there's any year or date column in the database.

Looking at the schema carefully:
- **superhero** table: no year/date column
- **hero_attribute** table: has `hero_id`, `attribute_id`, `attribute_value` — no year/date column
- No other table has any temporal/year data

The claim asserts that the average attribute value of neutral superheroes "has increased steadily **every year since 2000**." This requires a year dimension to track changes over time. However, the database has **no year or date column** in any table. There is no way to determine when a superhero was added, when attributes were assigned, or to group data by year.

This is an **OUT-OF-SCHEMA** situation — the claim references a concept (yearly temporal data) that does not exist in the database.

```json
{"label": "NOT ENOUGH INFO", "reasoning": "The claim references yearly trends ('increased steadily every year since 2000'), but the database contains no year, date, or temporal column in any table. There is no way to track changes over time or group attribute values by year. This is an out-of-schema concept that cannot be verified."}
```
